name: Casper the friendly ghost R19/SD16/F5 --> a self concealment build
author: Pan Draconis

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content:
This one is simple and versatile, he's balanced between rogue and SD to get many epic SC, F5 for AB and decent damages against sneak immunes (you also have traps abd umd)
Strenghts : SCV, epic dodge, 32 naked AC, HiPS, improved evasion, crippling strike, EWS, epic traps, full UMD, 42 AB, 2WF, 10d6 SA.
Weakness : will saves. Use buffs or items to be mind-effects immune. Ok, so there's no weaknesses (kidding).

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This is a neat build, demonstrating how to max out bonus feats from rogue and SD.
The skill focus in disarm let you reach 48 without buffs or items.
Let me suggest a minor improvement/tweak; stop tumble at 40 ranks and drop heal and put those skill points in open lock instead. That's more rogue-like at least.

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content:
Very good suggestion Mick, I will make the tweak.

I like this kind of "mathematical" build, even if a more roguish version should be better at offense, I really like the SD abilities. And my build has slippery mind, which a rogue build have to sacrifice. For modules with improved SD class this combo should be very interesting.

I will test it as soon as possible.

posts.author: BluntAxe
posts.content:
I really like this build with @Mick Dagger improvements - it would also be interesting as a half elf or human - maybe even a dwarf!?

It'll struggle against crit/sneak immune but in a party it has skills and survival and and a damage dealer.

Nice work

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I have a tiny suggestion.  I would take Two Weapon Fighting first and then Ambidexterity.  TWF benefits both hands, but Ambi only benefits the left hand.  If you don't intend to dual wield until you have both feats, then it doesn't matter.

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content: Tested at level 1 - 18. Very strong and defensive, slow against sneak immunes, that's a dex rogue build after all !
